items.message: The Aldingbourne and Barnham Rifes are currently slowly falling, following an extremely wet November. Flooding may continue to affect fields near Shripney Lane and the A259, the car park at Tesco and Riverside Caravan Centre and Rowan Park Caravan Park. The next five days are currently predicted to remain dry and will allow the river level to fall further. Flood impacts should continue to ease, however, river levels could remain higher than normal through to next week. Through Shripney and Bersted minor flood impacts may still continue. River levels will remain sensitive to future rainfall. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including Shripney Lane. We continue to routinely clear grilles through Barnham, including at the Trading Post and our pumps at Felpham are running to reduce flood risk. We will re-issue this message if the risk of flooding to properties increases.

River levels remain high but steady at the Brimscombe river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall, consequently flooding of roads and farmland continues. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Elmore to Sharpness. Other locations that may be affected include Chalford, Leonard Stanley and Cambridge. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days and are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 5:00pm on 05/12/22 or as the situation changes.

River levels have continued to slowly and are now below the flood alert level at the Briantspuddle gauge on the River Piddle. The forecast is dry for the next couple of days. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days. We continue to monitor the situation and issue appropriate messages should conditions change.
